page.title: 04ST. PETERS CHURCH,BIRCH
page.content: The present church of St.Peters was built by Charles Gray Round of Birch Hall in 1849 on the site of Great Birch Church which was demolished. It is{built of stone and flint}with a tile roof. The elegant stone{spire rises 40m.above the village and is a local{landmark. Unfortunately the stonework is crumbling and the tile roof needs urgent repair. The estimated cost for repair is 125,000 pounds. During the last months the Parochial Church Council and local people have been discussing its future and an appeal fund has been launched to{restore}it. The Rector, the Rev. H. Giddings is also in charge of the churches of Layer Breton and Layer Marney.
